abstract: Murder of Ana Charle, director of Bedford-Atlantic Men's Shelter in Bronx by former resident in April has prompted officials to review security measures at New York City's 256 homeless shelters; news of killing has hit close to home for city's shelter workers, who recognize risks their jobs present.
lead_paragraph: Since the killing in April of a shelter worker by an ex-resident, the city has increased security, added safety training and convened an interagency task force.

headline.main: New York City Takes Steps to Increase the Safety of Employees at Homeless Shelters
headline.print_headline: City Takes Steps to Increase the Safety of Employees at Homeless Shelters
